poem:
"In the Courthouse Shadows"

Red gavel, striking
against the body's right, spills
Agonies of dispute. 
New edicts ring, emerging from
hushed shadows, trading 
freedom for derision.

Through great Corinthian halls
the echo spread-
Spurring political pulsation,
the green tide of backlash rises.

Red gavel, striking, 
resolves not, but stirs
the populous turmoil
in the belly of our nation.
